'''''All the Devils Are Here: The Hidden History of the Financial Crisis''''' is a nonfiction [[book]] by [[author]]s [[Bethany McLean]] and [[Joseph Nocera]] the [[Financial crisis of 2007â2010|2008 financial crisis]]. It details account of how the financial crisis bubbled up from a volatile, and bipartisan, mixture of government meddling and ''[[laissez-faire]]''. It concludes (According to ''Bethany McLean'' and ''Joe Nocera'') it was not an accident, that banks understood the big picture before the crisis happened but continued with bad practices.
'''''All the Devils Are Here: The Hidden History of the Financial Crisis''''' is a nonfiction [[book]] by [[author]]s [[Bethany McLean]] and [[Joseph Nocera]] the [[Financial crisis of 2007â2010|2008 financial crisis]]. It details account of how the financial crisis bubbled up from a volatile, and bipartisan, mixture of government meddling and ''[[laissez-faire]]''. It concludes (According to ''Bethany McLean'' and ''Joe Nocera'') it was not an accident, that banks understood the big picture before the crisis happened but continued with bad practices.
  +   +
== The name ==
  +   +
The name of the book comes from [[The Tempest]], a play by [[William Shakespeare]] where he wrote "Hell is empty, and all the devils are here."
